purpose: Data points from screenshots to implement in On The Clock platform

screenshot_1.name: Team EPA Metrics - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_1.description: Team-level EPA per dropback and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
use_cases: Strength of schedule analysis
Player value adjustments (offense quality context)
Matchup analysis (opponent defense quality)
Trade analysis (identify buy-low candidates on bad offenses with good EPA)

screenshot_2.name: Team Rushing EPA Metrics - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_2.description: Team-level rushing EPA per rush and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
insights: Best rushing offenses: BUF (0.091), WAS (0.089), DAL (0.052)
Worst rushing offenses: NE (-0.313), TB (-0.167), SEA (-0.154)
Best run defenses: TB (-0.318), LV (-0.277), DET (-0.228)
Worst run defenses: NO (0.160), TEN (0.118), BAL (0.108)
use_cases: RB value context (quality of offensive line and scheme)
Rushing matchup analysis (opponent run defense quality)
Game script predictions (teams that can run effectively control clock)
Dynasty RB evaluation (offensive environment matters more for RBs than any position)

screenshot_3.name: Team Explosive Play Rates - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_3.description: Team-level explosive play percentages (20+ yard passes, 15+ yard rushes) for both offensive and defensive units
insights: Best explosive pass offenses: SEA (7.2%), LAR (6.2%), BAL (5.3%), DEN (5.3%)
Best explosive run offenses: NYJ (11.7%), BAL (10.5%), DEN (8.0%)
Most explosive passes allowed: DAL (7.8%), NE (5.8%), TEN (5.1%), HOU (5.2%)
Most explosive runs allowed: NE (11.0%), CAR (9.7%), TEN (8.5%)
use_cases: Identify big-play WR/RB threats (high upside dynasty assets)
Matchup analysis for DFS and weekly starts (target defenses giving up explosives)
Ceiling projection adjustments (explosive offenses have higher weekly variance)
Deep threat WR evaluation (teams that generate explosive passes create WR1 weeks)
Game script prediction (explosive offenses can score quickly, affecting pace)

screenshot_4.name: Run Blocking & Rush Defense - Yards Before Contact
screenshot_4.description: Team-level offensive run blocking quality (yards before contact per attempt) and defensive rush defense quality (yards before contact allowed)
fields: OFF_YBCo_ATT (offensive yards before contact per rush attempt - run blocking quality)
DEF_YBCo_ATT (defensive yards before contact allowed per rush attempt - run defense quality)
insights: Best offensive run blocking: BAL (3.02), JAX (2.53), LAR (2.39), DEN (2.34)
Worst offensive run blocking: CIN (0.68), SF (1.02), NYG (1.07), PHI (1.14)
Worst rush defenses (most YBC allowed): NE (2.62), NO (2.26), TEN (2.19), LV (2.18)
Best rush defenses (least YBC allowed): MIN (0.51!), TB (0.80), BUF (1.10), NYJ (1.13)
use_cases: RB value context (offensive line quality is critical for RB success)
Dynasty RB evaluation (good O-line = sustainable production, bad O-line = regression risk)
RB matchup analysis (target RBs facing defenses that allow high YBC)
Trade analysis (RBs on bad O-lines with good individual stats = sell-high opportunities)
Rookie RB landing spot evaluation (O-line quality predicts rookie RB success more than draft capital)

screenshot_5.name: Gap Rushing Concepts - Mid-Gap Attack Rate & Efficiency
screenshot_5.description: Team-level gap rushing schemes showing mid-gap attack frequency, yards per carry, and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
fields: OFF_MG_ATT_pct (offensive mid-gap attempt percentage - how often they run between the tackles)
OFF_GAP_YPC (offensive gap rushing yards per carry)
DEF_GAP_YPC (defensive gap rushing yards per carry allowed)
DEF_GAP_SR (defensive gap rushing success rate allowed %)
insights: Most gap-focused offenses: ARI (59.6%), WAS (54.3%), TB (54.0%), CLE (51.1%)
Most efficient gap rushing: SEA (7.31 YPC), IND (6.20), WAS (6.05), DAL (5.91)
Best success rate gap rushing: DAL (61.4%), IND (61.7%), NYJ (60.0%)
Best gap rush defenses: NYJ (1.89 YPC, 19.4% SR!), SEA (2.84 YPC, 28.1% SR)
Worst gap rush defenses: TEN (5.72 YPC, 56.6% SR), CAR (5.56 YPC)
use_cases: RB scheme fit analysis (gap runners vs outside zone runners)
Power back vs speed back evaluation (gap runners need power, outside zone needs speed)
O-line scheme identification (gap-heavy teams = power/inside zone scheme)
Rookie RB projection (match RB skillset to team's rushing scheme)
Weekly matchup analysis (target gap runners facing weak interior defenses)

screenshot_6.name: Zone Rushing Concepts - Outside Zone Attack Rate & Efficiency
screenshot_6.description: Team-level zone rushing schemes showing outside zone attack frequency, yards per carry, and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
fields: OFF_ZONE_ATT_pct (offensive zone attempt percentage - how often they run outside zone)
OFF_ZONE_YPC (offensive zone rushing yards per carry)
DEF_ZONE_YPC (defensive zone rushing yards per carry allowed)
DEF_ZONE_SR (defensive zone rushing success rate allowed %)
insights: Most zone-focused offenses: SF (63.2%), LV (60.8%), SEA (60.2%), NYJ (59.5%)
Most efficient zone rushing: BAL (6.98 YPC!), WAS (6.15), BUF (5.81), LV (5.37)
Best success rate zone rushing: BUF (64.2%!), WAS (59.3%), KC (58.5%)
Best zone rush defenses: DET (3.32 YPC, 34.2% SR), BUF (3.25 YPC, 39.3% SR)
Worst zone rush defenses: MIA (6.05 YPC), LV (5.24 YPC, 54.8% SR)
use_cases: RB scheme fit analysis (zone runners need vision/patience vs gap runners need power)
Speed back vs power back evaluation (zone schemes favor elusive, patient RBs)
Complementary skill analysis with screenshot #5 (teams high in both = diverse scheme)
Rookie RB projection (identify which teams use zone-heavy schemes)
Dynasty RB value context (zone backs age better due to less contact)

screenshot_7.name: Pass Blocking & Pass Rush Matchups - Pressure Rates
screenshot_7.description: Team-level pass protection quality (pressure rate allowed) and pass rush quality (pressure rate generated)
fields: OFF_Press_Rate_Allowed (offensive pressure rate allowed % - pass protection quality, lower is better)
DEF_Pressure_Rate (defensive pressure rate generated % - pass rush quality, higher is better)
insights: Best pass protection: JAX (17.1%!), DEN (31.1%), MIA (31.1%), SF (32.9%)
Worst pass protection: NYJ (55.1%!), PHI (50.0%), CIN (44.9%), NYG (44.9%)
Best pass rush: LAC (48.2%), NE (47.2%), JAX (46.5%), SEA (46.5%)
Worst pass rush: NO (28.7%), LAR (29.9%), MIA (30.2%), LV (31.6%)
use_cases: QB value context (pass protection quality is critical for QB success and injury risk)
WR/TE value context (clean pockets = more time for routes to develop = more targets)
Matchup analysis (target QBs/pass catchers facing weak pass rushes)
Dynasty QB evaluation (elite O-line = career longevity and sustained production)
Injury risk assessment (QBs behind bad O-lines have higher injury risk)

screenshot_8.name: Passing Efficiency - YPA & CPOE
screenshot_8.description: Team-level passing efficiency metrics showing yards per attempt and completion percentage over expected for both offensive and defensive units
fields: YPA (offensive yards per attempt - passing efficiency)
CPOE (offensive completion percentage over expected - QB accuracy vs difficulty)
CPOE_Allowed (defensive completion percentage over expected allowed)
insights: Best passing offenses (YPA): IND (8.91), SEA (8.93), BAL (8.45), LAR (8.13)
Best QB accuracy (CPOE): NE (9.4%), SEA (9.1%), NYJ (8.5%), BAL (8.5%)
Worst passing offenses: TEN (4.91 YPA, -7.7% CPOE!), CLE (5.09 YPA), NO (5.13 YPA)
Worst pass defenses: DAL (9.16 YPA, 13.8% CPOE!), MIA (8.79 YPA), WAS (8.63 YPA)
Best pass defenses: BUF (5.48 YPA), LAC (5.55 YPA), SF (5.61 YPA)
use_cases: QB dynasty value assessment (CPOE shows true accuracy vs offensive system)
WR/TE value context (high YPA offenses = more deep threat opportunities)
Matchup analysis (target pass catchers facing weak pass defenses)
Buy-low identification (good CPOE with low YPA = QB hindered by scheme/weapons)
Sell-high identification (high YPA with low CPOE = unsustainable efficiency)

screenshot_9.name: Receiver Matchups By Alignment - Fantasy Points by Position
screenshot_9.description: Team-level fantasy production by receiver alignment (outside wide, slot, tight end) for both offensive production and defensive allowance
fields: OFF_OutWide_FPG (offensive outside wide receiver fantasy points per game)
DEF_OutWide_FPG (defensive outside wide receiver fantasy points allowed per game)
OFF_Slot_FPG (offensive slot receiver fantasy points per game)
DEF_Slot_FPG (defensive slot receiver fantasy points allowed per game)
OFF_TE_FPG (offensive tight end fantasy points per game)
DEF_TE_FPG (defensive tight end fantasy points allowed per game)
insights: Best outside WR production: BAL (16.5), TB (14.6), DAL (15.9), LAC (15.0)
Worst outside WR defenses: DAL (19.6 FPG!), JAX (14.2), NO (13.8), LV (13.6)
Best slot WR production: DET (12.3), HOU (12.3 allowed), BUF (11.3), KC (11.7)
Worst slot WR defenses: HOU (12.3), DET (9.2), CIN (8.3)
Best TE production: SF (15.5), BUF (15.6), DET (14.0), LAC (13.1)
Worst TE defenses: HOU (14.7), SEA (14.3), CIN (13.5), DAL (12.5)
use_cases: WR/TE role-based matchup analysis (outside WR vs slot WR vs TE)
Dynasty WR value by role (outside WRs = higher volume, slot WRs = safer floor)
Weekly lineup decisions (target slot WRs vs weak slot defenses)
Trade analysis (identify WRs changing roles = value shift)
Rookie WR projection (landing spot role matters - outside vs slot)

screenshot_10.name: Receiver Matchups By Coverage - Fantasy Points vs Coverage Types
screenshot_10.description: Team-level fantasy production by defensive coverage type (zone, two-high safety, man, one-high safety) showing offensive efficiency and defensive usage rates
fields: OFF_ZONE_FPDB (offensive fantasy points per dropback vs zone coverage)
ZONE_FPDB (zone coverage fantasy points per dropback allowed)
OFF_2H_FPDB (offensive fantasy points per dropback vs two-high safety)
2H_FPDB (two-high safety fantasy points per dropback allowed)
OFF_MAN_FPDB (offensive fantasy points per dropback vs man coverage)
MAN_FPDB (man coverage fantasy points per dropback allowed)
OFF_1H_FPDB (offensive fantasy points per dropback vs one-high safety)
1H_FPDB (one-high safety fantasy points per dropback allowed)
insights: Best vs zone coverage: BUF (0.71), LAC (0.48), NO (0.47), WAS (0.47)
Best vs man coverage: BUF (0.86), BAL (0.73), SEA (0.74), LAC (0.72)
Most zone-heavy defenses: IND (93.3%!), NYJ (87.6%), NYG (82.7%), CLE (81.4%)
Most man-heavy defenses: DAL (33.7%), BUF (30.4%), DET (31.4%), LAC (31.2%)
Most two-high safety: MIN (58.2%), IND (61.3%), NO (59.8%), TEN (55.5%)
Best vs two-high: MIA (0.62), CAR (0.63), NYG (0.56), SEA (0.57)
use_cases: WR/QB matchup analysis by coverage tendency (zone beaters vs man beaters)
Dynasty WR value by skillset (man coverage = elite separation, zone = route running)
Weekly DFS lineup optimization (stack pass catchers vs favorable coverage)
Trade evaluation (WRs moving to teams that play more man/zone)
Rookie WR projection (landing spot coverage context matters for year 1 success)

implementation_notes: Will design and build features after all 10 screenshots are collected
